summary: A gangster (Manoj Bajpayee) clashes with the ruthless, coal-mining kingpin (Tigmanshu Dhulia) who killed his father (Jaideep Ahlawat).

reviews.content: I admit that at times I didn't know what was going on or who was whom.  Still, I sat through the full 5+ hours in one sitting.  It's fast paced and has a true "epic" quality.  I'm a big fan of the gangster genre though.  If you aren't you might want to give this one a pass.

One of the best gangster films with a comical portrayal of characters, but filled with some of the most gruesome scenes. It is better if it is treated almost like a miniseries due to its slow premise (but never disengaging). The payoff is worth it if you have a bit of patience. Powerful acting displays with no weak links whatsoever. A weird and quirky score but worked well with the tone of the film. Highly recommended!
StoryLine was Amazing
One of the best gangster movies there is.

I didn't know who Anurag Kashyap was before I saw this film. And my mind was blown. This is the best gangster movie Bollywood has ever made, and that's saying something since Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai also exists.

When the film begins, it seems like it will be the same old, generic good guy vs bad guy movie. But as the story progresses, the line between the good and bad people blurs to the point where it doesn't exist anymore. In the beginning it feels like Sardar Khan is supposed to be the hero, but slowly he's shown to be a terrible person who gets in fights with everyone and marries a second time just because he's getting horny.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui's Faisal is introduced in the second part after the demise of Sardar Khan. The bad guys really make you feel like killing them, and the way they speak is very reminiscent of the villages from Bihar and east UP. The acting by literally everyone is phenomenal, such that it inspired memes for years to come, and that's being in a good way. Every scene has been choreographed so well it actually gives you the feeling of those poor, low class families from suburban areas.

It doesn't matter how many web series come up - Mirzapur, Paatal Lok, Sacred Games. The fact remains that Gangs of Wasseypur is the OG that started it all, and no one can ever replace its legacy.
Violence portrayed realistically. It portrays sexual assault and abuse in a way that many, many other Bollywood films do not.
Everything about the movie is soo good!

There is a reason this movie is considered to be the Godfather of modern Indian cinema ... and that is because it is exactly that. Violent, charming, and occasionally funny, this movie (split between 2 parts) is so engrossing you won't even know where the 5 and a half hours went. The casting is superb, the gully acting seems genuine and the plot continues to thicken, generation after generation. If you want to watch a modern Indian masterpiece, look no further!
Mind blowing awesomeness. It has it all. I might even watch it again, too many details that are hard to enjoy while reading subtitles :P.
It is one of the masterpieces of Bollywood. Everyone has aced in their acting. Top notch story, screenplay, direction, background score. Just epic.

Undoubtedly, this film is the Magnum Opus of Anurag Kashyap's filmography which transcends the raw madness, hysteria, black comedy, and vengeance beyond borders. The best motion picture Bollywood has ever produced.
Best movie ever made in history of cinema

Seldom does a film like this one come out of Bollywood. You take your hat off to the brilliant cast, screenplay, acting, music and of course, the directing. The sheer scope of this epic is a testament to the courage and skill of Kashyap. I have the privilege of hailing from the same state(Jharkhand) mentioned in this work, and can appreciate the incredible mimicking of the local culture, language and the slurs. It seems too real to feel like a movie, and yet it constantly reminds that this is nothing more than a movie through its pop references and the famous Ramadhir Singh's dialogue about the hindi cinema.

You might argue that Gangs of Wasseypur is nothing but the love child of Francis Coppola's 'The Godfather' with William Shakespeare's 'Hamlet'. But even by keeping int those standards, 'GoW' soars as a modern classic because it frames characters and layered narratives with unpredictable arcs of straightforward relationships, giving it the textured getaway for an unflinching morality tale. 
But this epic drama has a lot more spice than to that account. It's a brave, unforgettable gem that's instantly relatable, for someone like me especially, who has heard of all of this as someone belonging to India's coal capital and who has friends in Wasseypur. Welcome Anurag Kashyap, welcome to the badlands!
A raw, absorbing, and bloody violent betrayal drama which moves you.
one of the greatest gangster movies ever made and possibly one of the best.
A cinematic masterpiece that will be studied by generations to come.
Best movie ever made in Indian history

One of the greatest gangster movies ever produced.This is a glorious, marvellous and the bloodiest masterpiece ever.I request every one to watch it. Bollywood should learn something from Anurag Kashyap as bollywood can't seem to get away from creating stupid,boring, senseless and poorly directed movies.Bollywood cant' seem to get away from overacting except Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Manoj Bajpayee.
The best gangster movie ever made

A dark and ridiculously realistic crime drama that has brought a new style of storytelling in Hindi Mainstream. The use of long takes, the use of organic music, the picture-perfect cast and the reference to many of Kashyap's favourite Hollywood classics, this film is a must-watch.
With over five hours, the volume packs up action and drama in Wasseypur through generation after generation. 
Starts with the story of Shahid Khan, followed by his death, his son Sardar Khan's reign, and finally ending in his grandson avenging all the deaths. The story of Wasseypur is well-written and well-executed.
Excellent Superb Mind-blowing
Absolute gem. Don't see any movies in future to challenge this movie.
This is a perfect gang-war movie. The character built and the screen play depicted is extra ordinary. I like the movies directed by Anurag Kashyap.
Best movie that Bollywood has made..

As a film buff, it is hard to watch a film like "Gangs of Wasseypur" and not at the very least appreciate the scope and attention to detail. The story is a long one that spans many decades and is told in two parts with a total runtime that surpasses five hours. Despite the long runtime, I found myself mostly engaged with the movie and I did feel that every scene contributed to either the story or developing the characters. However, on the same token, the movie had a lot of moments that I did feel bored by since it is sometimes uneventful. Regardless, I still think as a whole, the film leaves a strong impression, with shocking violence at every corner, and storylines that impact future events. The strong performances in the movie feel authentic and add to the realism the movie is going for and every character is complex. It's a unique film for Bollywood as it is more commonly compared to Hollywood films such as "The Godfather" or works by well-known director Martin Scorsese. While watching the movie I understood why these comparisons are made so frequently as the film has a similar look and feel to the films it is compared to.
This one of the best movies from india..
just say, Awesome movie.
A Bollywood Raw Portrait of  Crime at its best. it sticks to it basics for full length, and you don't get such an ensemble cast which only sticks to acting.
Just an incredible movie. The depictions of Indian life feel very real. The villians and heros are over dramatized, but otherwise just an amazing movie.
Slow and terrible at first but it picks up along the way. The end of part 1 and the whole of part 2 was awesome. Somewhat similar to The Godfather but its asian flavor makes it differently amusing.
An explosive crime saga that runs for over five hours and looks quite stunning and sophisticated for an Indian commercial production. Full review on filmotrope. com
Well thought-out plot. Brilliant acting. Well directed. Entertaining and well-executed portrayal of Colonial Northern India.

A film desperately in need of an editor...

A story spanning several decades, condensed into 320 minutes (!).  Set in the city of Wasseypur, India, two rival factions have been fighting each other for many years.  We see how the feud began, and how it developed...

Boring and, at 320 minutes, seemingly interminable to the point of being painful.  Based on the story outline, the movie had potential: a gangster movie spanning several decades - quite Godfather or Goodfellas-like.  However, the execution leaves a lot to be desired.  Incredibly unfocused with pointless detours and sub-plots.  Pretty much just drifts for all those 320 minutes.

A bit (actually, a lot) of editing, and much more focusing on the main plot and the movie could have been interesting.

On the plus side, the usual Bollywood nonsense of random song-and-dance scenes is kept to a minimum.  In fact, no dancing, just singing.  The small amount of musical interludes is also a negative in a way.  When I saw how long the movie was I figured it was because it had the usual song-and-dance stuff, and I would just fast forward through that.  Alas, no such luck.
Can be a chore to watch at some moments, but it's extremity and vibrant soundtrack make it fun too.

I was going to stop after ep. 2, but I finished this overlong gangster saga just to see what's the raves all about...
Story was pretty good, but the realization it's  a no-brainer to me, plus the unnecessary singing and dancing...

A veritable masterpiece in the gangster genre, GANGS OF WASSEYPUR covers three generations of the Khan clan in a corrupt mining state in northeast India. The Khans vie against the Singhs for power, control, and revenge. This is a little more like watching Fredo raise a family than capturing Michael's astute rise to power, and it's all the more fun for it. We don't get enough of the catalytic patriarch Shaheed Khan (Jaideep Ahlawat). We spend a little too much time with his philandering asshat of a son Sardar Khan (Manoj Bajpayee), but even he occasionally amuses and leaves us with several sons sparring for the role of don. The ultimate godfather being Faizal Khan (Nawazuddin Siddiqui), who is certainly my favorite.

The movie is admittedly long (technically 2 parts). It could be shorter if the montage sequences set to music (but not dance!) were cut, but I'm not sure I would want that. The soundtrack is dope as hell, and while the story isn't really moving during the not quite Bollywood as I knew it music scenes, the lyrics and beats are killer. GANGS opens with a one shot capturing an attack on the current Khan in charge. I didn't think the action scenes could be more epic than the opening, but I was mistaken multiple times. Also, what an excellent use of slow motion! This movie is not for the faint of constitution, but if you're a HARDBOILED fan, do yourself a favor and check out GANGS OF WASSEYPUR.

I don't quite get the raves about this. It starts off well enough, with some memorable sequences and characters, but as it moves into its second half, with frankly uninteresting survivors (some being downright stupid and annoying), it becomes increasingly silly and dull.

97%
Viewed this on 14/9/15
Gangs of Wasseypur is better than any of the gangster films ever made by the west in all it's prime years and even at a length of 5 hours (released as two separate films in India), Wasseypur still dazzles. It captures the heart of the place and is one amongst the best films to have ever been made in the country. Moreover, the performances and the twists are simply superb. Anurag Kashyap directs with style.

One dry raw Crime Drama with lot of kick-ass characters that emerges in between the most stylish middle Indian Movie ever made, ''Gangs of Wasseypur'' is a very rare piece of work that has the usual elements like feud, vendetta, squabble that rocks the screen as the flow commence.

The special thing of this flick is that each and every character that appear is thoroughly designed and has given the special style to be presented, as each one character demise there come the new and much more crazier role than before which has its own anecdote to say, Anurag Kashyap the mastermind behind this work had crafted it so consciously by giving importance for every peculiar aspects of the story, character design is so well made that each role has its own way of presenting style.

This Gang war movie with its well specialized technical crew and extremely talented artists has all the quality to be considered as the cult flick, it may be crazier and instinct driven character of Manoj Bajpai or silently violent cold blooded performance by Nawazuddin Siddiqui and well matured performance by Richcha Chadda takes this movie to total next level, nowhere we could find the stint of work by any character that passes by, this five hour movie never make bore at any phase.

Technical aspects like cinematography, editing are so perfect, most importantly the presentation of the story with its special jewels of intensification gives the unique identity for every characters, the peppy music are very timely played and the bgm's has succeeded in holding the grip over the audience, totally this is one best work by well mastered team in cinema.
A really well-done movie. when you watch it, you can feel that you're among them and in their own city and house. lots of bitter truth have been placed in its homogenous story.
this Indian movie is comparable with The God Father of hollywood
Magnificent performance by Manoj Bajpai (expected) and Nawazuddin Siddiqui (not expected).

LOVE IT

Full review soon.
Really interesting movie about the lawlessness of the UP state in India
Nice movie ! An article I think is a must read for all those who like this movie : http://j.mp/1fHR1hP
Best movie Bollywood has ever produced.

A story of this scale and level of intricacy had probably never been told in Hindi Cinema until Gangs of Wasseypur. Anurag Kashyap did in this movie what he does the absolute best, create well-rounded, strong yet disfunctional and vulnerable characters and inhabit them in a realistic world (filled with violence and gore obviously, because its still an Anurag Kashyap film). Sardar Kahn, Faisal Khan and Ramadhir Singh are the characters I will probably never forget. And the dialogues like 'Kehke lunga uski' will certainly be the words I'll always curse my enemies with. Gangs of Wasseypur quickly raised to be one of my favorite films of all time and will be there for long into the future.

People may compare this movie with City of God but I must say Gangs Of Wasseypur has taken this kind of film making into another level. All the actors in both parts 1 and 2 are fantastic. The characters are unknowingly interesting.

Spectacular. Never expected this in Hindi cinema..thoroughly amazed. Breathtaking action which runs faster than your heartbeat. Part 1 and 2 together makes for an amazing watch. Superb direction which is very refreshing and some amazing performances. A must watch, especially for the lovers of gangster flicks.
A nasty rundown of greater life of Crime, criminals, warlords and opportunists in post-independent India..
A masterpiece from India! Bajpai is terrific! Part 2 is equally tense!
Bloody and straightforward !

best movie till date by kashyap 
performance of manoj is all over the movie, good work of riccha chadha
Awesome. Story of revenge, greed and betrayal. Some brilliant acting and great direction!
Too off beat for me.
A cult film( the GOW series). Some exceptional performances especially by Nawazuddin makes this the best of the genre.

This epic crime drama from one of India's most acclaimed directors rewrites the rulebook on popular notions of Indian cinema.  Taking his cue from the likes of Sergio Leone, Martin Scorsese and Francis Ford Coppola, Kashyap fashions a grand tale of greed, politics, survival, vengeance and violence in the small coal mining town of Wasseypur in the Dhanbad district in north-eastern India.  Interestingly, Kashyap deftly showcases India's corrupt politics, the inexorable link between money, crime and politics and society's obsession with the popular cinema with the control and discipline of a master puppeteer.  His eye is never critical, but more observational, making the film more chilling and brutal.  Keeping the pace brisk, the action constantly engaging and the tone realistic, he fashions a gangster saga for the ages, using multiple strands to tell a story of warring factions fighting for control of the coal and iron businesses in the region in a tale as great and complex as India itself.  It is sometimes hard to keep track of all the characters and their links to this great tapestry, but the brisk pace and compelling storytelling will draws you in and refuse to surrender you till the last reel.  Repeated viewing will only serve to further enhance and appreciate the sheer raging brilliance of this film, which will make you change your opinion of Bollywood forever.

Fantastic movie. Incredibly realistic, drenched in violence with deft touches of humor. The story never lags, and you never lose interest, which is quite amazing given the length of the film. One of the all-time greatest films to come out of Bollywood. On the heels of Black Friday, Kashyap has given us another masterpiece.
its bloody confusing .................

Brutal and unflinching this two part indian crime saga redefines the way films are made in India and offers a realistic portrayal of the Indian Mafia in Jharkhand.
This is film-making at its very best!!
Bollywood cinema can't get better than this

What a surprise Gangs of Wasseypur was. I was a bit skeptical going into the film considering how lame and overly melodramatic most modern Bollywood films are. The acting was the absolute best I have seen in a Bollywood film, so was the direction, the musical score, the editing and just about everything else, in other words it's just about the best Bollywood film I have ever seen. Gangs of Wasseypur is what you get when you mix The Godfather, Quentin Tarintino and City of God and chop them into one film, and the result is something to behold. Truly breathtaking.
see this movie it will change your definition of Indian cinema

Give it a chance and you'll never look at Bollywood the same way again.

Gangs of Wasseypur, one of my all time favorites!!
Good movie. Editing could have been better.

A superb,brilliant thriller after a long long time in bollywood!!
Part II is much more entertaining and is a must watch!
in bollywood history never made this type of movie.everything is perfect.

Undoubtedly one of the best Indian films in recent times.
Anurag Kashyap, Manoj Bajpai & Nawazuddin all give their career best.
Best movie of its times.. the 2nd part has pretty good funny one liners as well.. watch both of them together Part 1 & 2 to get thos whole zist of the story..

Once you start seeing it as a collection of experiences, characters, and histories, rather than a coherent plotline, it really asserts character. Is this Bollywood's Godfather? Maybe not, but its definitely extremely Tarantino-esque.
Dark...humorous...thrilling....Brilliant! Anurag Kashyap may well be dubbed as the "Tarantino of India"...
Must watch for exceptional performances, Anurag Kashyap and Kickass soundtrack by Sneha Khanwalkar- Dont miss it. Also second part of this movie.
Good thoughts with clumsy making.

Kudos to Anurag Kashyap and the principal writer Syed for taking this bold step setting the movie in a crime hinterland with quirky characters grounded in their own reality and to some extend this team is successful. It captures the true essence of the crime and politics scene in post independence bihar and afterwards. The movie is filled with amazing performances by the superb cast. The movie captures the quirkyness of these characters and decorated it with the amazing music from the composer Sneha Khanwalker. Special mention is the breakout actor Jaideep Ahlawat who reigns the screen in the first quarter of the film. The movie sometimes feels refrencing to City of God in the structure. Having said that, the movie suffers from 'passion project syndrome'...at times it feels like the director and writer did not want to let go of any of the scene. Result, it stretches too long and very poorly edited. The movie suffers from the structure issue from the script and in the second half may feel like episodic in nature.
Overall, wonderful try from the director known to venture into risky stories with success in comparison to his peers in indian cinema and he almost gets it right.
finally got to see the movie sequel. Liked it good!!
The best freaking movie of 2012

Given the hype around the movie. it was the most horrible movie I saw, the plot just dragged on, the romantics parts were bad, to summarize, there was nothing good about the movie. Luckily I saw it on flight between Bangalore and Delhi, so nothing lost

The best film of the year 2012 ,amazing cast and performance .It spans over a period , watching the entire 6 hr film is experience of lifetime. The characters are so real that we are able to feel the anger, ego and their want for power.A revenge saga that span several decades.

A must watch !
A revenge saga well scripted and directed by Anurag Kashyap.
A very nice movie but has lot of gore and blood shed.. only for mature audiences who love to watch Anurag Kashyap genre of movies.
A Indian adaptation of Godfather in rural backdrop. A good film.
Anurag Kashyap does a Godfather for the bollywood, and does it well.
decent watch, not great
Delicious Revenge drama with fabulous musical score although tad self-indulgent! Nonetheless, Anurag Kashyap, you are a game changer!
Kashyap was definitely serious about this... but that somehow didn't translate into anything remotely interesting.

A very well made gangster flick.....one of the few movies in which you can say that part 2 was better than part 1.....An epic Indian Gangster flick.......really enjoyed watching it.Language may b a problem for few......A MUST WATCH!!!!
An Indian cinematic masterpiece !!
Gangs of Wasseypur directed by Anurag Kashyap may have a similar story to those of Bollywood crime movies,but his direction,the taut screenplay and powerful performances makes this worth-watching!

One of the best Indian movies in recent time, this movie will be remembered years from now as a milestone in Indian cinema.  An epic story of revenge that starts in the 1940's and sees it thrilling conclusion in 2004, this movie is a rollercoaster ride of politics & gang rivalry. The acting is flawless and the direction is brilliant. The movie does tend to get slow at times, but the intricacy with which the story is binding, it makes for a thrilling 6 hours movie (Divided into two parts). Special mention to Manoj Bajpai's brilliant acting.

Unlike the Hollywood 'inspired' movies made by most mainstream Indian moviemakers, Gangs of Wasseypur works well within the Indian milieu as Anurag pays homage to the works of Sergio Leone, Quentin Tarantino and Fatih Akin. 

Perhaps it has the finest cast in a single Indian movie I've seen in the last decade. The movie though could have been trimmer by at least an hour with unnecessary songs and the cacophonous background music removed. 

Still see 'That Girl in Yellow Boots' and 'Black Friday'' as Anurag's best where he shows a distinctive style of his own. Hope he becomes a great moviemaker rather than remaining  a good one by taking this distinctive style forward in his subsequent workpieces
.

Crime saga at its best. Revenge, blood, deceit, guns, gangs, wars, politics and dialogues. All of this in native Bihari dialect. Epic. Even though the genre is similar to other crime movies produced in India, the originality however lies in the story. A tale of revenge that runs in the family, three generations down thereby unleashing a wave of killings. 

The first part was completely owned by Manoj Bajpai (Sardar Khan) whose impeccable performance reaches far. Whether comic lines, serious taunts or seducing Reema Sen or playing husband to Richa Chadda, he is simply brilliant. Very well supported by other actors. The second part was dominated by the pot smoking Nawazuddin Siddiqui (Faizal Khan) as he aims to continue taking revenge on Ramadhir Singh (Tigmanshu Dhulia) for killing his grandfather, the same way Sardar Khan spent his whole life taking revenge for his father's murder. Second part adds on more lively characters in the Khan family, like Perpendicular and Definite, who are new actors but nonetheless great to watch. 

The ending somehow let me down because during the last quarter it was clearly evident as to where the movie was headed. Brilliant music score by the newcomer Sneha Khanwalkar is very raw, witty, different and touches the right notes with regards to the theme of the movie. Specially Oh Womaniya, insane lyrics!!!!

A colourful and a classic saga!! Another gem from the Anurag Kashyap stable!!
best film ever made in indian cinema
Pretty good gangster flick!
kia keh kay li hai bhi wah.
something that i was waiting for a long long time
amazingly well made! music is refreshing.
someday, all bollywood movies should be atleast this good.

The sequel to Gangs of Wasseypur starts with the death of Sardar Khan (Manoj Bajpai). We see him getting caught in a barrage of gunshots and finally succumbing to it. The scene of his funeral is comical to a certain extent with a singer with an unusual voice singing a famous Hindi number. Immediately after this scene, we are taken back to the gruesome world of murder and mayhem that Anurag Kashyap had shown us in Gangs of Wasseypur.

This world is laden with men who mould themselves after Bollywood heroes and with revenge in their hearts; they roam around the town of Wasseypur coolly creating a realm of violence and crime. Amidst all the chaos and bloodshed, Anurag Kashyap and his crew follow a curios path of violence, humor, romance and music to bring out a revenge story that spans generations.

After watching Gangs of Wasseypur, it might seem that the sequel is lacking in parts. Despite the exuberance, you will feel the movie is nothing but a series of butchering and killing with no particular story that links them together. There are times when logic flies out of the window. The prequel took time to bring out the characters and the storyline. However in the sequel, we get to see nothing but a bunch of wannabe crime lords battling it out with guns, murdering and creating mayhem in broad daylight. It seems the characters are just moving according to the set of instructions given by the director.

One of the funny moments in the movie comes up when we see a gangster attempting to tie the string on his pajama while talking on two mobile phones. We have an edgy assassin on one phone while a spy who has been asked to follow a target is on the other phone. The scene is cleverly written and portrayed.

Chase scenes have been the forte in Gangs of Wasseypur II. But they seem to have been stretched too far. One felt that Anurag Kashyap was trying to out-do himself after the fantastic chase scenes in Black Friday. He was trying to go a notch higher. The starts in the four chase scenes in the movie are brilliant and exciting, but the brilliance and the interest seem to fade away after a few minutes.
However like Gangs of Wasseypur I, Kashyap is brilliant in bringing out the characters in the sequel. We are introduced to a group of charismatic personalities. Apart from the growing enmity between Ramadhir Singh (Tigmanshu Dhulia) and Sardar Khanâ(TM)s hash-addicted successor Faisal (Nawazuddin Siddiqui), we come to know of Perpendicular. He is Faisalâ(TM)s kin who has the habit of wielding a blade in his mouth and goes around with an I-donâ(TM)t-give-a-damn attitude. Faisal is a hardcore follower of Amitabh Bachchan while his half-brother Definite thinks Salman Khan is God. Faisalâ(TM)s wife Mohsina is a movie-addict who sings in a queer voice at the slightest opportunity. Faisal is shown as a person who, despite his unwillingness, was dragged into the world of crime. Together with Definite, they go about carving a revenge for the murder of their family members. 

The movie is a goldmine of stellar performances. Richa Chadha as the sturdy matriarch, Aditya Kumar (Perpendicular) and Huma Qureishi (Mohsina) are brilliant and brings their characters alive. However, the one person that has made a mark for himself with his brilliant performance is Nawazuddin Siddiqui, who has essayed the role of the bold Faisal Khan. 

If there is any fatal mistake in the movie, it is the introduction of innumerous subplots and characters. This trend continues till the end of the movie. This one major flaw has stopped Gangs of Wasseypur II from rising above the genre of a typical revenge flick.
Its a well cast movie with an interesting narration, suitable production design and engrossing screenplay! Recommended!

Using his Old Technique of Filming in Tracking Shots and Using Neophyte Casts , Anurag kashyap once again brings another Dark flick that keeps you the edge of the seat despite lame acting from cast. With numerous Casting and long length of the film , movie revolves around the life of gangsters since time of independence, filled with unending gunshots , naive gangsters, daylight direction, making it difficult to grasp the story line but still make it a worth watching.

Anurag Kashyap's story telling is always different and entertaining. But this one is not as good as it is being reviewed by critics. I thought violence could have been converted to gore. It is being said that 2nd part is much more entertaining...will have to watch it

Along with Carlos it's probably the best modern crime drama around. It's a long, violent, chronicle of fathers, sons, mothers, grudges, business and everything else that makes the crime drama so entertaining and harrowing at the same time. It may not be everyones cup of tea but if you like Indian cinema or crime films this one is a must watch.

I had a chance to experience Gangs Of Wasseypur Pt1 & 2 at TIFF festival. It's a brilliant gangster flick from India. If you can't stomach violent movies please don't watch it. Makes scarface look like child's play. The almost 6hrs movie fly by quicker than most 2hr movies I've seen.

Always admire Kashyap's ability to juxtapose the reprehensible with the beautiful. A wonderful cast of underutilized actors in Bollywood is put to great use here, with a tight screenplay. Kashyap has re-established himself as a true visionary, but as all his films do, this one also left me a bit cold. His films are more intellect than heart, I think, but a must-watch (the second best film of the year, after Shanghai).
More violent, muscular half strikes contrary notes on view of post-Bollywood influence. Engaging, but bloated.

just saw the screening at the Sydney film festival. Its definitely one of the best Hindi movies ever made. Direction, screenplay, narration, acting, music, cinematography, everything about this movie is top notch. Anurag Kashyap is truly the best at whatever he does. You wont even feel the length of 5 hours and 20 minutes. Manoj Bajpai's has proved once again that he is the powerhouse of acting. Not one scene is out of order and everything is properly explained with no questions unanswered. Dialogues are very sharp and as close to reality as it can get.

The opening sequence in itself is a masterpiece. The way its scripted and executed is just mind blowing. All the bloodshed keeps getting more and more innovative. Its one of those movies that will always be mentioned everywhere whenever someone talks about the Indian cinema.
Epic tale from Indian cinema, its almost like savouring a fine wine as it grows on you. I loved every character and look forward to Part 2 eagerly!
The indian "godfather" ...great story!!! Waiting to see 2nd part!
Dint give it a full 5 cos i lost track of the numerous characters in this truly EPIC movie.
Its Anurag Kashyap's materpiece
This is the best bollywood movie i have ever seen,honestly it took my breath away

Mr. kashyap latest outings into film directing are once again epic and breath taking...........gangs of wasseypur could be compared to the godfather with regards to some aspects , but things are really messy here and thats the difference........ where in the godfather there is much sophistication to their method and violence...... wasseypur is a free-for-all stab fest ,with raw emotions overruling any kind of logic or thought  ........... manoj bajpai, richa chadda and the rest of the cast do a marvelous job here , especially bajpai, but one cannot expect anything else from him .......... this movie is a prime example of what bollywood should be like .......... more focus on acting and plot and less on other nonsense .......... all in all 4 outta 5

Interesting. Just finished GOW 1 & 2. Slightly different approach and a good sequel. Started right where it left off and delivered a pretty decent story. Could have made it shorter, but we all know that doesnt happen in bollywood movies. Would I watch if there is a third part? Yes. Definitely.
Just one word ..... Epic.. Nawazuddin and Manoj bajpaye are awesome

will never forget that one-take shot that runs for almost 10mins when Faizal Khan escapes from his house during the shootout... a marvelous piece of work from the Master ... Take a thousand bows Mr Kashyap :D
amazing! electrifying!!! another powerhouse film from kashyap.
Just watched it, nothing that great so far the story of 3 generations with loads of blood and coal :)
Not as good as I expected...the 1st half seems like a documentary.2nd half picked the pace...GOW2 seems promising..
Psrt onr rocks. Waiting for the more...

Day: Wednesday
Date:  15 Aug 2012
Time: 11.00 pm
With: No one
On: Laptop

Current India on Independence Day
Pretty good. But a little slow. Not as violent as led to be believed by the reviews.

Another masterpiece from Anuragji,  mind blowing dialogues and sensitive direction. This movie is truly the Mahabharata of Wasseypur.

GoW2 is even better. Subtle artwork direction in a commercially viable venture is classic. It explains everything yet says nothing. The end that ensure the completion of the saga far removed from Wasseypur, the impotent narrator with the baby and bahu, and the two people who are highly integrated in this mess of betrayal left standing with their "jurisdictions" divided. Painful, yet true. 

Faizal running from terrace to terrace during the shooting is my favourite scene. Done in film noir, handheld camera, and absence of background music - the scene heightens to a wonderful peak of tension climaxing at the breaking of the leg coupled with the phone ringing in the background.

"Anytime moodwa ko, upsetaoon nahi mooda"

A gangster flick that failed to click. With me, that is. Hope the sequel would be better, and more worthwhile than this not-so-engaging chaos. Not being a professional critic grants me an immunity from the obligation of rating an Anurag Kashyap venture at least 3/5. (Can afford the freedom of arrogance for the time being, although arrogance has played no part in my rating of this flick.) 1.5/5 with a generous heart.
Definite-ly Pulpendiculul!
too much hype for an OK movie

An enthralling and bloody look at three generations of a crime family in Bihar, India. Full of beautifully choreographed action sequences and some incredible one liners. It certainly raises the bar for what Indian cinema should strive to achieve.
Best  movie of the year
Does have its moments... still didn't find it as good as was being made out to be...

its becoz of directors lyk anurag kashyap u cn xpect bollywood movies to hv some international standards... GOW is some really leathal stuff from this man .. may it b the make-up of a character or the accuracy of acting and dialogues...he has defined the term 'realistic' for bollywood..
